thread.title: Did Detroit Tigers' Randy Wolf finish his career Sunday?
thread.title_full: Did Detroit Tigers' Randy Wolf finish his career Sunday?

author: freep.com
title: Did Detroit Tigers' Randy Wolf finish his career Sunday?
text:
MORE CHICAGO -- It was a tip of the cap.
Detroit Tigers manager Brad Ausmus talked to Randy Wolf about it during the week, about getting him another appearance this season, and he did in Sunday’s 6-0 win over the Chicago White Sox to end the season.
“It was really nice to get me in there,” Wolf said. “It could be my last inning, it may not be, but the fact that Brad got me in there and we were able to hold Daniel’s lead, it was nice. It was really nice to get in there.”
Wolf, 39, might have thrown the final pitch of a 16-year career in the scoreless sixth inning, and if he did, the left-hander threw it in relief of a youngster, Daniel Norris, he has mentored this season with the Blue Jays and Tigers.
“Daniel’s my guy, obviously,” Wolf said. “I’ve been a bad influence on him for about a year now, and it was nice to go out there and for Brad to get me in.”
Wolf and Norris, 22, became close while pitching with Triple-A Buffalo this season.
Wolf signed with the Blue Jays on March 18 but was in the minor leagues all season until he was traded to the Tigers for cash Aug. 18.
He posted a 6.23 ERA in eight appearances — seven starts — this season.
Wolf is 133-125 with a 4.24 ERA with the Phillies, Dodgers, Padres, Astros, Brewers, Orioles, Marlins and Tigers.
“Maybe he’ll play again,” Ausmus said. “But if not, at least he had a good inning his last inning.”
Contact Anthony Fenech: afenech@freepress.com. Follow him on Twitter @anthonyfenech .
